name: Pengo
overview: Basically, it's Pengo meets Bubble Bobble. You're a penguin in a maze made out of ice blocks – you kill your enemies by pushing the ice blocks onto them. Game has 64 levels, a 2-player mode, lots of hidden things, lots of bonuses, and a brilliant 'evil boss': the Sarvebuk. Well, sarve is Estonian, and comes from sarv which means horn. Buk doesn't really mean anything. Sarvebuk means, insofar it has a meaning, a buk with horns. It's a word programmer's (Martin Rebas) brother Hannes invented when he was maybe five years old. This game took a year to write, mainly because Martin did his best to make the game really user-friendly and compatible with different Amigas & screen modes. The finished program consists of 23000 lines of assembly code.
